intro: Calonemorchis hastata, commonly known as the narrowleaf calonemorchis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture. Calonemorchis hastata is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
